content.webTitle: Guardian film wins at the Documentari Inchieste Giornalismi Festival

fields.headline: Guardian film wins at the Documentari Inchieste Giornalismi Festival
fields.bodyText: Guardian film ‘How Steve Bannon’s far-right ‘movement’ stalled in Europe’ has won the Investigative Medium category, which includes investigative works up to 27 minutes long, at the Documentari Inchieste Giornalismi (DIG) Festival. The DIG Festival is an international conference that celebrates and awards the best investigative documentaries in the world. ‘How Steve Bannon’s far-right ‘movement’ stalled in Europe’ saw Guardian associate editor Paul Lewis follow Bannon’s operation across Brussels, Rome and Venice – challenging the former chief strategist to Donald Trump over his media hype and the legality of his intervention. The film was part of the Guardian’s The New Populism project. A full list of the The DIG Festival award finalists can be found here.
